thread.title: Women in business finalists announced by Phoenix Chamber.
thread.title_full: Women in business finalists announced by Phoenix Chamber.

author: Ted Vollmuth, Phoenix Small Business Marketing Examiner
title: Women in business finalists announced by Phoenix Chamber.
text:
Women in business finalists announced by Phoenix Chamber. Use your key for the next article Comment bing images 
Every year the Greater Phoenix Chamber of Commerce ( www.phoenixchamber.com) presents top women in business the prestigious ATHENA Award. On August 17th the organization named the 11 women chosen as finalists. 
The businesswoman of the year award honors women in both the public and private sectors and recognizes an upcoming leader with the young professional award. Women are selected for excellence in business, excellence in leadership, community dedication and mentorship of other women. This year’s finalists in the private sector are: Judi Butterworth of Velocity Retail Group; Heidi Jannenga of WebPT; Melissa Sanderson of Freeport-McMoran, Inc. and Kay Wing of Southwest Advanced Neurological Rehabilitation. Finalists in the public sector are: Cathy Brown of First Things First; Lillian Garcia of the American Red Cross; Sunnee O’Rork of i.d.e.a. Museum and Leah Fregulia Roberts of the Arizona School for the Arts. Finalists for the young professional honor are: Jessica Hipskind of the University of Phoenix; Ashley Kasarjian of Snell and Wilmer, L.L.P. and Lea Phillips of Ballard Spahr, L.L.P. 
“These women represent professional excellence and leadership of the highest quality with a genuine desire to inspire, develop and support other women,” writes Todd Sanders, president and CEO of the Chamber. “They make our community a better place in which to live, work and play.” 
One of the finalists is Melissa Sanderson of Freeport-McMoran, Inc. “I will continue to try to live up to the high standards set by previous ATHENA recipients,” she says. Yet another finalist is Sunnee O’Rork of the i.d.e.a. Museum. “The Phoenix Chamber’s ATHENA Award is widely recognized and held in high esteem as something any woman in business would want to receive,” she states. 
“It is an honor for the Greater Phoenix Chamber of Commerce to highlight the leadership, community service and contributions of these women to continue to tradition of the ATHENA Award,” concludes Sanders. 
The Chamber will present three award recipients at its 28th annual ATHENA Award luncheon Thursday, October 29, 2015 from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. a the Arizona Biltmore. To register for the event go online at www.phoenixchamber.com/athena15 . Registration closes Thursday, October 22 at 5 p.m. You may call 602-495-2182 for information.
